title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4030.5 - Disposition of money or prize
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4030.5 - Disposition of money or prize

State Regulations

Any money or prize which, by the conditions of the race
is to go to the horse placed second or in any lower place in the race, shall, if the winner has walked over or no horse has been so placed, be dealt with as
follows: (a) If part of the stake, it
shall go to the winner. (b) If a
separate donation from the association or any other source, it shall not be
given at all. (c) If entrance money
for the race, it shall go to the association. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4030.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
